runs.comm: he drifts on to the pads and is welcomed with a powerful sweep that sends it down to deep backward square leg boundary
this time he comes forward and eases it to long on for a single
it's on the pads again and the batsman tickles it fine to the leg side, but straight to short fine leg

whoa whoa! No one is ready to wait! Asif serves up a statement of intent as he launches into this flighted delivery and sends this as high as long.. It lands close to the sight screen. Wonderful strike
flatter this time, the batsman comes forward and defends

what an eventful over this has turned out to be! Asif, probably a touch too keen, sees a full delivery but doesn't get the kind of elevation he got two balls ago. Not an ideal short to play when you already have 11 from the over and there is a fielder at long on! It is straight down the throat of Jamil. Swart is ecstatic
he starts off with one down the leg side and it's called a wide
this time he corrects the line and beats the bat as the batsman looks to guide it down to third man
a forceful punch this time from Amjad as he blasts this length ball to mid-off
this one is full and on the pads, some swing too and the batsman misses the flick completely. He wasn't expecting that line

Timber!!! His over aggression has consumed him! Was that short necessary? I am not sure. It was a length delivery, a touch too full  to pull, but the batsman swivelled on his heels like he wanted to send it into the tea gardens, but could only chop it on to his stumps..
length delivery, the batsman gets hit on the pads but the batsman misses
fuller delivery on off side, the batsman pushes it to point
he starts off with a skiddy length delivery, the batsman defends it to midwicket
poor ball this one, it slips down the leg side and is called a wide
he looks to push this length delivery to the off side but gets an inside edge on to his pads
nice bit of outswing from Bukhari! The batsman walks towards the pitch of the delivery, but is beaten as it swings away late to beat the bat
he stays in the crease this time and punches the fuller delivery to mid on
he looks to cut this short of length delivery through point, but tries too hard possibly.. Chops it towards off side and calls for a quick single
he stays in the crease and cracks the length delivery down to third man for a single
the captain stays in the crease and dabs the length ball to mid on for a single
short delivery but not much pace on that, the batsman pulls it to deep square leg without much timing

whoa! What timing from Khurram this time! It was quick and it was full outside off, the batsman just jammed his bat down at the precise moment to get maximum out of it, it flew through point.. No one moved
another good looking shot from Khurram, who flicks this off his hips towards deep square leg. He didn't make any effort to keep it down and that went to the fielder on the bounce
fuller length delivery on the pads, the batsman misses his flicks but it grazes the pads and runs down fine on the leg side
fuller length on the off stump line, the batsman punches it back to the bowler
he stays in the crease and guides the length delivery down to third man for a single
nice looking flick this time! He allows the full delivery to come to him and turns it to deep midwicket with a wristy shot
goes wide of the crease and tries to spear it in, but goes down too far
he beats the batsman with a straighter one as Patil plays inside the line
fuller delivery on the middle stump line, Patil punches it to wide mid on for a quick single
attempts a short delivery, but there is not much pace on it. Khurram, though, ducks under it well in time
another short delivery, but this is down the leg side and Khurram swivels to hook that one. He gets some glove on it and takes a single to fine leg
looks for a cut, but there is not much width on the delivery and he ends up chopping it through the vacant first slip region for a couple
beautifully hit! Khurram comes forward, goes low as soon as he sees it's full and caresses it through cover for a boundary
fuller delivery on the pads, the batsman misses his flick and the bowler appeals for lbw, but that pitches well outside leg stump
he stands upright and punches the length delivery to the left of mid off for a single
full and just outside off, Khurram comes forward and punches it on the up to mid off
this is marginally short and the captain is quick on the pull! He gets a thick top edge but luckily for him, it lands safely at deep midwicket. the fielder hauls it back in time
too straight from the bowler, Patil nudges it to square leg for an easy single
flatter and slower on the off stump line, but Khurram goes deep in the crease and turns it to deep midwicket with a wristy punch
fuller delivery on off, Patil drives it to long off for a single
moves about the crease and ends up distracting the bowler, who fires this down the leg side. The batsmen take a bye as the ball passes through the keeper's legs
full and flighted, driven to deep midwicket for a single
on the pads again, the batsman nudges it to the right of short fine leg for a single
it's almost a yorker but Patil punches it to long on with ease
he starts off with a full delivery on off that the batsman punches straight to mid off
he has short-arm jabbed this to extract good value! It wasn't too short, but Patil went deep in the crease and whacked it to deep midwicket with ease, straight off the middle
turns over the strike by guiding this one down to third man

what a good pull is that! Flat and off the middle, it travels quickly enough and lands just inside the boundary ropes to the right of fine leg. It was a quick delivery, but Khurram was quick to pounce on that
oh this is wayward! It would have been a wide for a right-hander, it is that far! The keeper had no chance and it runs away to the boundary. The partnership crosses 50
marginally short of length and Khurram whips it stylishly off the back foot. It's half pull half flick, but there is protection in the deep
looks to flick the full delivery, but gets a leading edge back to the bowler
that is a poor delivery first up! He pitches it half way but is lucky to get away as the batsman cuts it straight to point
this one is too full now, it's a low full toss that is flicked straight to fine leg. Another misses opportunity for the batsman
he skips down the pitch and chips the flatter delivery to long off for a single
now Khurram comes down the pitch and punches this one down to long on for a single
flat, short, Patil misses out as he pulls it straight to deep midwicket
very full and the batsman chooses to use the paddle shot, but again, straight to short fine leg fielder
the batsman punches it to the leg side where midwicket dives and prevents the single
gives the bowler a charge and pulls the short delivery straight to deep square leg
beats the bat as the offcutter grips the surface and cuts away enough
another slower delivery, this time it's too straight though and Khurram punches it to long on for a single
he looks to work this away on the leg side, but gets an inside edge on to the thigh pad. Picks up a single to the off side though
it's a yorker alright, but it's on the pads and the batsman manages to get just enough bat to slide it fine on the leg side for a boundary
hammered down the ground and the long on had no chance! He charged down the pitch and took it on the full, slamming it straight past the bowler
oh no, too cute from Patil and he pays the price! He looks to play a cheeky late cut on one that is not wide enough. Sadly for him, he just manages to chop it on to his off stump
pushed through on the stumps, the batsman punches it back to the bowler
he waits on the back foot and pushes this to long off for a single

wicket number two in the over! Again, the stumps take a beating! Khurram Khan makes the same mistake as Patil - he looks for a late cut when there is absolutely no room. The ball is not even short enough and it keeps coming in with the angle. That's a big wicket for Netherlands
he works it away to square leg for a single

What. A. Shot! It's just a punch, mere punch, but audacious to play early in the innings. He just picks this length delivery and whacks it over mid-off with a straight bat, it just lands inches short of the boundary
stays in the crease and opens the face to run it down to third man
length delivery, waits on the back foot and defends it to off
short ball, doesn't bounce much, but the batsman pulls it along the ground to deep midwicket for a couple
another good looking shot! He gives the bowler a charge and lifts the length delivery straight over the non-striker's head. There was a long on in place but he had no chance of cutting it off
slower delivery this time, the batsman dabs it to the off side and calls for a quick single
big shot again! But he gets a bottom edge towards deep square leg
full and flighted, the batsman pushes it to midwicket with soft hands and comes back for a second
shuffles across the stumps and again pushes this with soft hands towards mid on for a well-run couple
quicker this time, the batsman come forward and drives it straight to cover
short delivery, the batsman wanted to punch it to the leg side, but gets a leading edge towards mid on
wonderful wonderful shot! Anwar makes some room and drives this handsomely over the extra cover region. The inside out drive takes it all the way. Superb shot
Mustafa walks into the shot and pushes it to long on for a single
he starts moving to the leg side, but the bowler follows him and he can only push it to cover
moves his front leg out of the way and chips the length delivery to mid-off for a single
back of length and on the pads, the batsman clips it to deep square leg for a single
comes down the pitch and chips the full delivery to long on. All these shorts are landing way short of the fielders in the deep
comes out of the crease but the bowler delivers a slower one, the batsman pushes it straight to cover point
very slow and outside off, the batsman gets a bottom edge to short fine leg as he goes for a sweep
he walks to the off side and clips the flighted delivery to deep square leg
comes down the pitch but is beaten by the flight and the slowness. The ball turns in and hits the pads and they take a leg bye
wow, another lovely inside out drive from Anwar! He makes room and powers it over extra cover

a chance for a stumping! If it is then it's excellent work by the keeper as it was a difficult! The batsman comes out of the crease but yorks himself. He misses and the keeper takes the bails off in a flash. Anwar hadn't gone too far out - his back leg was just over the line - and he tries to pull it back by lifting it! That is the case actually, is the foot in the air? Looks like he might have just touched down in time. It looks just fine to me..

that is got to hurt! The batsman blasts it back down the pitch and the bowler puts his body in line.. The force of the ball takes it to midwicket after hitting the bowler on the knee. What more, it could have been a catch! But a hard one. It smacked him on the right knee
Cheeky shot! But it was a full toss anyway. Anwar walks to the off side and just laps it fine on the leg side for a boundary
looks to hit down the ground, but ends up slicing it to deep point as the bat turns in his hands
this is hit very hard! It was full and it was wide, but it still needed to be whacked and Mustafa does that, freeing his arms and cannoning it to deep extra cover boundary

a direct hit catches Mustafa short! The batsman pushed it to midwicket for a quick single but he had no chance against he rocked throw that took down the stumps at the non-striker's end. The umpire doesn't wait for his colleague upstairs to play with the buttons
short and wide, easy pickings for Anwar who stays back and chops it past point for a boundary

wonderful yorker! Four Wicket Four Wicket. Anwar throws his bat but this one was headed for the middle and skids under the bat to hit the base. Anwar is disappointed as there are still four overs to come after this
slower delivery on the pads, Javed flicks it easily behind square to pick up his first runs

in the hitting zone but the batsman is unable to clear the boundary. Good catch by Seelar, who moves to his left from deep midwicket and swallows that just by the boundary. UAE are losing their way here - still four overs remaining
he bowls a good yorker this time and the batsman punches it to long off for a single
a slower delivery this time, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to cover
another offcutter, the batsman opens the face of the bat and punches it to deep cover
another slower ball, this time he hits the pads from round the wicket, the batsman takes a leg bye to short third man
good yorker again by van der Gugten! The batsman digs it out in time
looks for a yorker again, but this is a low full toss that is punched to deep cover for a single
full delivery on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to cover for a quick single
another attempted yorker, it's right up to the batsman who pushes it straight to cover
goes wide of the crease and shortens the length, the batman chops it to gully for a single
nice yorker again, the batsman jams his bat down a little late to be beaten. Van de Gugten ends his spell
a good yorker from wide of the crease, the batsman takes a step down the crease and punches it to long on for a single
full and on the pads, the batsman looks to flick it fine, but gets an inside edge on to the pads. They pick up a single as the ball rolls to the off side
poor delivery! It's a low full toss down the leg side and all the batsman has to do is to show it direction, which he does well. It beats the fine leg fielder comfortably
another poor delivery, again down the leg side. The keeper does well to dive across and get to this one
he comes down the pitch and punches the full delivery to long on
slower delivery, it messes with the batsman's attempted chip. He gets an inside edge on to the pads, but the two pick up a single

full and slow, the batsman digs it out to long on and calls for a second. But this throw from long on -- Tom Cooper it is - catches the batsman well short of the crease. Flat, quick and on target, it hits the stumps direct at the non-striker's end
slower delivery, the batsman hoicks too early, misses and is hit on the thigh pads, they take a leg bye
another slower delivery, the batsman misses again. This is good bowling. He was too early into his shot

slower delivery no. 3! This time the batsman gets some bat on it, but it's a worthless contact as he lobs it gently towards the bowler. If there was an award for a dolly, this would have taken the cake. No force on that shot, just a limp lob
another slower delivery, the batsman again just ends up lobbing it, but he is lucky as it's to the leg side and they pick up a single to midwicket

slower delivery, first proper contact in this over! But no change in fortune as the batsman is caught at deep midwicket. The bat made a good sound, but it just went up and the fielder ran in from the deep to take a good forward-diving catch
